QconfObject¶

class uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject[source]¶

Bases: object

This class encapsulates data and functionality common to all Qconf API objects.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Object name. If provided, it will override object’s name from data or JSON string parameters.
  • data (varies) – Object data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from object’s JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Object metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from object’s JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Object’s JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a Qconf object.
check_user_provided_keys()[source]¶

Checks for presence of all data keys that must be provided by user.

Raises:InvalidRequest - in case object’s data is not a dictionary, or if any of the required keys are missing.
remove_optional_keys()[source]¶

Removes values for keys that are not required from object’s data.

Raises:InvalidRequest - in case object’s data is not a dictionary.
set_add_metadata()[source]¶

Sets default object metadata (user/timestamp) for API add operations.

set_get_metadata()[source]¶

Sets default object metadata (user/timestamp) for API get operations.

set_modify_metadata()[source]¶

Sets default object metadata (user/timestamp) for API modify operations.

to_json(use_uge_keywords=False)[source]¶

Converts object to JSON string.

Parameters:use_uge_keywords – if True, UGE keywords (e.g. ‘NONE’) are restored before conversion to JSON; otherwise, no changes are made to object’s data. Default is False.
Returns:Object’s JSON representation.
to_uge()[source]¶

Converts object to string acceptable as input for UGE qconf command.

Returns:Object’s UGE-formatted string.
update_with_required_data_defaults()[source]¶

Updates object with default values for required data keys.

Raises:InvalidArgument - in case object’s data is not a dictionary.

QconfDictList¶

class uge.objects.qconf_dict_list.QconfDictList[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject, UserList.UserList

This class encapsulates data and functionality common to all Qconf objects based on a list of dictionaries.

__init__(data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • data (dict) – Configuration data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Configuration metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Configuration JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not represent a list of dictionaries object.
check_user_provided_keys()[source]¶

Checks for presence of all data keys that must be provided by user.

Raises:InvalidRequest - in case object’s data is not a dictionary, or if any of the required keys are missing.
to_uge()[source]¶

Converts object to string acceptable as input for UGE qconf command.

Returns:Object’s UGE-formatted string.
update_with_required_data_defaults()[source]¶

Updates list objects with default values for required data keys.

Raises:InvalidArgument - in case object’s data is not a list, or one of the list members is not a dictionary.

QconfNameList¶

class uge.objects.qconf_name_list.QconfNameList[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject, UserList.UserList

This class represents list of names returned by various qconf commands. It supports all standard python list interfaces.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – List name.
  • data (list) – Name list data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from object’s JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Name list metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from object’s JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Name list JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a QconfNameList object.

AccessList v1.0¶

class uge.objects.access_list_v1_0.AccessList[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject

This class encapsulates UGE access list object.

VERSION = '1.0'¶

Object version.

NAME_KEY = 'name'¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = ['name']¶

Object keys that must be provided by access list.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'oticket': 0, 'type': 'ACL', 'fshare': 0, 'entries': None}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Access list name. If provided, it will override access list name from data or JSON string parameters (‘name’ key).
  • data (dict) – Access list data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from access list JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Access list metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from access list JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Access list JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing an AccessList object.

Calendar v1.0¶

class uge.objects.calendar_v1_0.Calendar[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject

This class encapsulates UGE calendar object.

VERSION = '1.0'¶

Object version.

NAME_KEY = 'calendar_name'¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = ['calendar_name']¶

Object keys that must be provided by user.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'week': None, 'year': None}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Calendar name. If provided, it will override calendar name from data or JSON string parameters (‘name’ key).
  • data (dict) – Calendar data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from calendar JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Calendar metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from calendar JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Calendar JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing an Calendar object.

CheckpointingEnvironment v1.0¶

class uge.objects.checkpointing_environment_v1_0.CheckpointingEnvironment[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject

This class encapsulates UGE checkpointing environment object.

VERSION = '1.0'¶

Object version.

NAME_KEY = 'ckpt_name'¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = ['ckpt_name']¶

Object keys that must be provided by user.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'ckpt_command': None, 'restart_command': None, 'interface': 'userdefined', 'when': 'sx', 'ckpt_dir': '/tmp', 'clean_command': None, 'signal': None, 'migr_command': None}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Checkpointing environment name. If provided, it will override environment name from data or JSON string parameters (‘ckpt_name’ key).
  • data (dict) – Checkpointing environment data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from environment JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Checkpointing environment metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from environment JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Checkpointing environment JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a PE object.

ClusterConfiguration v1.0¶

class uge.objects.cluster_configuration_v1_0.ClusterConfiguration[source]¶

Bases: uge.objects.qconf_object.QconfObject

This class encapsulates UGE cluster configuration object.

VERSION = '1.0'¶

Object version.

NAME_KEY = None¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = []¶

Object keys that must be provided by user.

REQUIRED_GLOBAL_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'rlogin_command': 'builtin', 'enforce_user': 'auto', 'auto_user_delete_time': 86400, 'max_unheard': '00:04:00', 'execd_params': ['KEEP_ACTIVE=ERROR'], 'max_aj_instances': 2000, 'lost_job_timeout': '00:00:00', 'max_jobs': 0, 'set_token_cmd': None, 'login_shells': ['sh', 'bash', 'ksh', 'csh', 'tcsh'], 'enforce_project': False, 'qlogin_daemon': 'builtin', 'default_jc': None, 'rsh_command': 'builtin', 'mailer': '/bin/mail', 'xterm': '/usr/bin/xterm', 'finished_jobs': 0, 'min_gid': 0, 'epilog': None, 'projects': None, 'shell_start_mode': 'unix_behavior', 'xprojects': None, 'auto_user_default_project': None, 'delegated_file_staging': False, 'execd_spool_dir': 'SGE_ROOT/SGE_CELL/spool', 'max_aj_tasks': 75000, 'enforce_jc': False, 'enable_lost_job_reschedule': False, 'rlogin_daemon': 'builtin', 'shepherd_cmd': None, 'auto_user_oticket': 0, 'load_report_time': '00:00:40', 'gid_range': '20000-20100', 'reprioritize': 0, 'cgroups_params': {'m_mem_free_soft': False, 'h_vmem_limit': False, 'forced_numa': False, 'killing': False, 'min_memory_limit': 0, 'm_mem_free_hard': False, 'freeze_pe_tasks': False, 'cgroup_path': None, 'mount': False, 'freezer': False, 'cpuset': False}, 'user_lists': None, 'max_u_jobs': 0, 'reporting_params': {'sharelog': '00:00:00', 'accounting': True, 'reporting': False, 'flush_time': '00:00:13', 'joblog': False}, 'qlogin_command': 'builtin', 'token_extend_time': None, 'administrator_mail': None, 'xuser_lists': None, 'max_advance_reservations': 0, 'reschedule_unknown': '00:00:00', 'jsv_url': None, 'load_sensor': None, 'auto_user_fshare': 0, 'pag_cmd': None, 'min_uid': 0, 'qmaster_params': None, 'loglevel': 'log_warning', 'jsv_allowed_mod': ['ac', 'h', 'i', 'e', 'o', 'j', 'M', 'N', 'p', 'w'], 'rsh_daemon': 'builtin', 'prolog': None}¶

Default values for required data keys for the global configuration. Value for execd_spool_dir key will depend on $SGE_ROOT and $SGE_CELL.

REQUIRED_HOST_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'mailer': '/bin/mail', 'xterm': '/usr/bin/xterm'}¶

Default values for required data keys for the host configuration.

__init__(name='global', data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Configuration name (default: ‘global’).
  • data (dict) – Configuration data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Configuration metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Configuration JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a ClusterConfiguration object.

class uge.objects.cluster_queue_v1_0.ClusterQueue[source]¶

This class encapsulates UGE cluster queue object.

VERSION = '1.0'¶

Object version.

NAME_KEY = 'qname'¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = ['qname']¶

Object keys that must be provided by user.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'s_stack': inf, 'subordinate_list': None, 's_rss': inf, 'notify': '00:00:60', 's_vmem': inf, 'slots': 1, 'qtype': 'BATCH INTERACTIVE', 'h_data': inf, 'h_rt': inf, 'priority': 0, 'owner_list': None, 'initial_state': 'default', 'h_core': inf, 'h_fsize': inf, 'min_cpu_interval': '00:05:00', 'resume_method': None, 'shell': '/bin/csh', 'ckpt_list': None, 'h_vmem': inf, 's_cpu': inf, 'epilog': None, 'projects': None, 'shell_start_mode': 'unix_behavior', 'h_cpu': inf, 'xprojects': None, 'suspend_interval': '00:05:00', 'd_rt': inf, 'hostlist': None, 'seq_no': 0, 'rerun': False, 'starter_method': None, 'prolog': None, 'h_rss': inf, 'nsuspend': 1, 's_rt': inf, 'calendar': None, 'suspend_method': None, 'tmpdir': '/tmp', 'user_lists': None, 'complex_values': None, 'suspend_thresholds': None, 'load_thresholds': 'np_load_avg=1.75', 's_core': inf, 'terminate_method': None, 'xuser_lists': None, 's_data': inf, 's_fsize': inf, 'h_stack': inf, 'pe_list': 'make', 'jc_list': ['NO_JC', 'ANY_JC']}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Queue name. If provided, it will override queue name from data or JSON string parameters (‘qname’ key).
  • data (dict) – Queue data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from queue JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Queue metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from queue JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Queue JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a ClusterQueue object.

This class serves as a base for UGE complex configuration objects.

Class constructor.

  • metadata (dict) – Configuration metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Configuration JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing a ClusterConfiguration object.

Object version.

NAME_KEY = 'name'¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = ['name']¶

Object keys that must be provided by set.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'limit': ['to slots=0'], 'enabled': False, 'description': None}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(name=None, data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Resource quota set name. If provided, it will override set name from data or JSON string parameters (‘name’ key).
  • data (dict) – Resource quota set data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from set JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Resource quota set metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from set JSON string representation.
  • json_string (str) – Resource quota set JSON string representation.
Raises:

InvalidArgument - in case metadata is not a dictionary, JSON string is not valid, or it does not contain dictionary representing an ResourceQuotaList object.

This class encapsulates UGE scheduler configuration object.

Object version.

NAME_KEY = None¶

Object name key.

USER_PROVIDED_KEYS = []¶

Object keys that must be provided by user.

REQUIRED_DATA_DEFAULTS = {'weight_deadline': 3600000.0, 'maxujobs': 0, 'queue_sort_method': 'load', 'prioritize_preemptees': False, 'load_formula': 'np_load_avg', 'job_load_adjustments': 'np_load_avg=0.50', 'flush_submit_sec': 1, 'share_override_tickets': True, 'halflife_decay_list': None, 'max_pending_tasks_per_job': 50, 'weight_department': 0.25, 'preemption_distance': '00:15:00', 'weight_waiting_time': 0.0, 'schedd_job_info': False, 'flush_finish_sec': 1, 'usage_weight_list': ['wallclock=0.000000', 'cpu=1.000000', 'mem=0.000000', 'io=0.000000'], 'backfilling': 'ON', 'schedule_interval': '0:0:15', 'load_adjustment_decay_time': '0:7:30', 'compensation_factor': 5.0, 'policy_hierarchy': 'OFS', 'weight_tickets_share': 0, 'algorithm': 'default', 'preemptees_keep_resources': False, 'max_preemptees': 0, 'report_pjob_tickets': True, 'preemption_priority_adjustments': None, 'share_functional_shares': True, 'max_reservation': 0, 'fair_urgency_list': None, 'weight_ticket': 0.01, 'max_functional_jobs_to_schedule': 200, 'params': None, 'reprioritize_interval': '0:0:0', 'weight_job': 0.25, 'halftime': 168, 'weight_priority': 1.0, 'weight_urgency': 0.1, 'weight_tickets_functional': 0, 'weight_project': 0.25, 'default_duration': inf, 'weight_user': 0.25}¶

Default values for required data keys.

__init__(data=None, metadata=None, json_string=None)[source]¶

Class constructor.

Parameters:
  • data (dict) – Configuration data. If provided, it will override corresponding data from JSON string representation.
  • metadata (dict) – Configuration metadata. If provided, it will override corresponding metadata from JSON string representation.
